definition[0]: an arrangement by which a bank pays a fixed amount of money from your account every month, year etc
definition[1]: an arrangement between a bank and a customer for the bank to pay a fixed amount of money regularly from the customer’s bank account to another account
example[0]: Customers can pay regular bills by standing order.
example[1]: With a standing order you tell your branch exactly how much is to be paid and when.
definition[2]: an arrangement in which goods are sent regularly in agreed amounts, without the customer having to make a new order each time
example[2]: They have cancelled their standing order of 12,000 copies a day of the newspaper.
definition[3]: an organization’s rules about how meetings should be held and organized
example[3]: Parliament is empowered to make standing orders to govern its procedures.
